oai_dc:dc.dc:descriptions: The name of the Lion not to be spoken by children. In the Katkop dialect, by Día!kwãin, from ≠kámme
4562). Another version of this warning (L V.

4573). The |xam avoid saying the lion's name so the flies cannot hear and report to the lion what they say; some of the lion's habits when killing game; what people must do when stealing game from a lion; they make signs or hand gestures to signify the lion instead of saying its name.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The avoidance of the name of the lion
